title: 114_hr6513
content: The "American Future Healthcare Act of 2016" may be cited as the short title. The Act includes reforms for Health Savings Accounts. The "American Future Healthcare Act of 2016" includes reforms for Health Savings Accounts, such as repealing the high deductible health plan requirement, increasing the HSA contribution limit to $10,000 ($20,000 for joint returns), allowing Medicare eligible individuals to contribute to HSAs, and amending the purchase of health insurance section. The "American Future Healthcare Act of 2016" includes reforms for Health Savings Accounts, such as repealing the high deductible health plan requirement, increasing the HSA contribution limit to $10,000 ($20,000 for joint returns), allowing Medicare eligible individuals to contribute to HSAs, and amending the purchase of health insurance section. Amendments are made to various sections of the Internal Revenue Code related to cost-of-living adjustments for catchup contributions and indexing to CPI medical care component. The cost-of-living adjustment for the calendar year is determined by substituting 'CPI medical care component' for 'CPI'. Conforming amendments are made to various sections of the Internal Revenue Code. Section 223 of the Internal Revenue Code is amended to redesignate subsections and make adjustments to specific subsections. Section 223(c)(1)(A) is amended to change references and dollar amounts. Section 223(f)(1) is amended to update the calendar year. Section 26(b)(U) is amended to correct a reference. Various other sections of the Internal Revenue Code are also amended. Sections 35(g)(3), 220(f)(5)(A), 848(e)(1)(v), 4973(a)(5), and 6051(a)(12) of the Internal Revenue Code are amended to replace references to "section 223(d)" with "section 223(c)". Additionally, amendments are made to Section 106(d)(1) and Section 408(d)(9) to reflect the changes in section references. Amendments are made to various sections of the Internal Revenue Code, including 877A(g)(6), 4973(g), and 4975, to update references from "section 223(d)" to "section 223(c)" and "section 223(e)". The amendments made by this section update references in the Internal Revenue Code from "section 223(d)" to "section 223(c)" and "section 223(e)". These changes will apply to taxable years starting after December 31, 2015. SEC. 3. HSA rollover to Medicare Advantage MSA. Section 138 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to allow for a HSA rollover contribution described in subsection (d)(5). An amount is considered a rollover contribution if it meets specific requirements outlined in the code. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 allows for a beneficiary to deposit received payments into a Medicare Advantage MSA within 60 days. This provision does not apply if the individual received similar payments from a health savings account in the past year. Amendment to the Internal Revenue Code allows for deposits into a Medicare Advantage MSA after December 31, 2015.
